item.title: First Work Experience
item.description: My first work experience was in the summer of 2005 when I Just turned 16 and finished the second year of high school (or was about to be junior in high school). Early that summer my father said: Go get a job son, and start working on your own But he never told me how to. I was fond of technical stuff since I was a child. So the only search algorithm for a job that came to my mind was walking in the streets near where we lived and looking for electrical shops, facilities, technical services, motor winding stores, etc.

item.title: Embedded System Hobbyist
item.description: Over about 10 years of being embedded system hobbyist I’d worked with various evaluation boards. Here is short story of me and my evaluation boards! Raspberrypi Model B It was around 1391 when I purchased this board. My first Linux board I Learn about cross compile and mounting rootfs over NFS Read Embedded Linux Primer by Christopher Hallinan Read Embedded Linux training by bootlin Tiny6410 In summer of 1393 I purchased this board from ECA eshop.

item.title: tp-link TL-MR6400
item.description: Introduction For implementation of my VP2S and VP2S2 personal server, I choose TL-MR6400 as 4G router. As said in VP2S, my Static IP is provided by Shatel Mobile 4G SIM card. Here is some tests and review I’ve done about this router. Package Here is what you get after un-boxing. Speed Test I did serval speed test (iperf) over LAN/WiFi. Also Internet speed was tested. During Internet test I had 4G link with RSRQ = -9dB.

item.title: Stanley Trigger Action
item.description: Introduction I was curious about how long Trigger Action can keep water temperature. So I prepared a setup in order to measure temperature profile. Here is what I’d done. Setup Main items in my setup include following items ESP8266 with Micropython firmware as central procession unit Water proof DS18b20 connected to ESP8266 over W1 bus. I used very thin wire for connection so I can close the hat putty terminal as logging agent Here is my setup (Not a very good picture, I know)
